Package doerfer

Class Board

java.lang.Object
doerfer.Board
public class Board extends Object
Class Board A Class that represents the Board The Board is adaptive in all 4 Directions Holds an ArrayList of the AdvancedTiles
Author:
Philipp Sch√§fer

  • Constructor Details

    • Board

      public Board(AdvancedGameConfiguration conf)
      Constructer for the Board with a given Config-File-String
      Parameters:
      conf - the AdvancedGameConfiguration to load the initial data from

  • Method Details

    • initialyze

      private void initialyze()
      TileGenerator generator a Helper Method to initialyze the Board with the config, only called by the Constructers

    • getTile

      public AdvancedTile getTile(int row, int column)
      Returns a tile from a given row and column, Can be an AdvancedTilePlaced or a DummyTile
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the Tile
      column - the column of the Tile
      Returns:
      the AdvancedTilePlaced from the given coordinates, null if given coordinates have no Tile or a DummyTile if given coordinates contain a DummyTile

    • getTiles

      public ArrayList<AdvancedTile> getTiles()
      Getter for the List of Tiles
      Returns:
      the List of Advanced Tiles containing a DummyTile or a AdvancedTilePlaced

    • getLastAddedTiles

      public ArrayList<AdvancedTile> getLastAddedTiles()
      Getter for the List of Tiles that were addded with the last addTile(), DummyTiles and AdvancedTilePlaced
      Returns:
      an ArrayList of Tiles that were added last

    • getLastRemovedTile

      public DummyTile getLastRemovedTile()
      Getter for the DummyTile that was removed with the last addTile()
      Returns:
      the DummyTile that was removed

    • addTile

      public boolean addTile(AdvancedTile tile, int row, int column, int rotation, int tilePlayerID)
      Adds a given Tile to the given parameters
      Parameters:
      tile - the tile to place
      row - the row to place the tile in
      column - the column to place the tile in
      rotation - the rotation of the Tile
      tilePlayerID - the Id of the Player who's tile this is
      Returns:
      a boolean if the Tile was added or not

    • addTile

      public boolean addTile(AdvancedTile tile, doerfer.preset.TilePlacement placement, int tilePlayerID)
      Adds a given Tile to the given placement
      Parameters:
      tile - the tile to place
      placement - the TilePlacement to place the tile in
      tilePlayerID - the Id of the Player who's tile this is
      Returns:
      a boolean if the Tile was added or not

    • placementIsViable

      public boolean placementIsViable(AdvancedTile tile, doerfer.preset.TilePlacement placement, int tilePlayerID)
      Method that checks if it is okay to place a given Tile at a given place
      Parameters:
      tile - the tile to place
      placement - the placement to put the tile in
      tilePlayerID - the ID of the Player whose Tile this is
      Returns:
      a boolean if it is viable to place a Tile there

    • placeDummyTilesAround

      private boolean placeDummyTilesAround(int row, int column)
      A private helper method that places DummyTiles around a given coordinate, only called by addTile
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the coordinate
      column - the column of the coordinate
      Returns:
      a boolean if it worked or not

    • addDummyTile

      private boolean addDummyTile(int row, int column)
      Private Helper Mothod to add a DummyTile to a given location
      Parameters:
      row - the row to add the DummyTile to
      column - the column to add the DummyTile to
      Returns:
      a boolean if the Tile was set or not

    • getNeighbours

      public AdvancedTile[] getNeighbours(int row, int column)
      Returns the Tiles around the given coordinates from north clockwise
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the Tile the neighbours are looked for
      column - the column of the Tile the neighbours are looked for
      Returns:
      an Array of the neighbouring AdvancedTiles or DummyTile

    • getNeighbourBiomeNorth

      public doerfer.preset.Biome getNeighbourBiomeNorth(int row, int column)
      Getter for the adjacent Biome north
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the Tile the neigthbour is wanted from
      column - the column of the Tile the neighbour is wanted from
      Returns:
      the Biome that is adjacent in the north, null if there is no Tile or a DummyTile

    • getNeighbourBiomeNorthEast

      public doerfer.preset.Biome getNeighbourBiomeNorthEast(int row, int column)
      Getter for the adjacent Biome north east
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the Tile the neigthbour is wanted from
      column - the column of the Tile the neighbour is wanted from
      Returns:
      the Biome that is adjacent in the north east, null if there is no Tile or a DummyTile

    • getNeighbourBiomeSouthEast

      public doerfer.preset.Biome getNeighbourBiomeSouthEast(int row, int column)
      Getter for the adjacent Biome south east
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the Tile the neigthbour is wanted from
      column - the column of the Tile the neighbour is wanted from
      Returns:
      the Biome that is adjacent in the south east, null if there is no Tile or a DummyTile

    • getNeighbourBiomeSouth

      public doerfer.preset.Biome getNeighbourBiomeSouth(int row, int column)
      Getter for the adjacent Biome south
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the Tile the neigthbour is wanted from
      column - the column of the Tile the neighbour is wanted from
      Returns:
      the Biome that is adjacent in the south, null if there is no Tile or a DummyTile

    • getNeighbourBiomeSouthWest

      public doerfer.preset.Biome getNeighbourBiomeSouthWest(int row, int column)
      Getter for the adjacent Biome south west
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the Tile the neigthbour is wanted from
      column - the column of the Tile the neighbour is wanted from
      Returns:
      the Biome that is adjacent in the south west, null if there is no Tile or a DummyTile

    • getNeighbourBiomeNorthWest

      public doerfer.preset.Biome getNeighbourBiomeNorthWest(int row, int column)
      Getter for the adjacent Biome north west
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the Tile the neigthbour is wanted from
      column - the column of the Tile the neighbour is wanted from
      Returns:
      the Biome that is adjacent in the north west, null if there is no Tile or a DummyTile

    • getNeighbourBiomes

      public doerfer.preset.Biome[] getNeighbourBiomes(int row, int column)
      Returns the Neighbouring Biomes starting with north clockwise
      Parameters:
      row - the row of the tile the neighbours are looked for
      column - the row of the tile the neighbours are looked for
      Returns:
      an Array of the neighbouring Biomes, null at the places where no Tile or a DummyTile is the neighbour

    • getPlacableDummyTiles

      public ArrayList<DummyTile> getPlacableDummyTiles()
      Returns an Array of all activated DummyTiles where a Tile can be placed
      Returns:
      the Array of activated DummyTiles

    • togglePlacableDummyTiles

      public void togglePlacableDummyTiles(AdvancedTile newTile, int playerID)
      Toggles the DummyTiles from board to match if newTile can be placed there or not
      Parameters:
      newTile - the Tile on the stack that should be placed
      playerID - the player ID of the player whose turn it is

    • toggleTileIfNecessary

      private void toggleTileIfNecessary(AdvancedTile newTile, DummyTile dummyTile, int playerID)
      Helper-Method that toggles a given DummyTile to match if newTile can be placed there or not
      Parameters:
      newTile - the tile on the Stack to check the positions with
      dummyTile - the tile to check and potentially toggle
      playerID - the ID of the player whose turn it is

    • resetCountedEdges

      private void resetCountedEdges()
      Iterates through every TilePlaced on the Board and sets all CountedEdges to false

    • countPoints

      public HashMap<Integer,Integer> countPoints()
      counts the ponts each player gets on the map right now
      Returns:
      a Hashmap that maps every PlayerID on the map with the points of the player

    • countBiomeAreaInterTileBorders

      private int countBiomeAreaInterTileBorders(AdvancedTilePlaced tp, int from, int direction, doerfer.preset.Biome biome, BooleanHolder neighboursDummyTiles, ArrayList<Integer> playersIncluded)
      Recursive Method that goes through the current Biome-Area and counts the Inter tile borders in it checks if the area neighbours a Dummy Tile
      Parameters:
      tp - the TilePlaced that contains the area
      from - the direction where the area is coming from, -1 in first call
      direction - the direction to check in, only not -1 in first call
      biome - the biome of the area
      neighboursDummyTiles - a BooleanHolder that contains a boolean if the Area bordes a DummyTile
      playersIncluded - an ArrayList of the Players in the area
      Returns:
      the amount of inter tile borders in the area
